task.title: QoS API Tutorial
task.shortdesc: How to use the RSubConnection API for QoS.

context.p: Quality of Service is implemented by setting parameters on a channel, a sub-connection RSubConnection within a connection RConnection.

step.cmd: Set parameters on a channel that is a sub-connection, RSubConnection.
step.info: RConnection contains one or more sub-connections. A default sub-connection is created automatically with the RConnection and any added RSubConnections. The RSubConnection API provides the functionality to divide a connection that is provided by the RConnection API into channels. The channels have properties such as bandwidth and latency.

step.cmd: Apply an RSubConParameterBundle to the RSubConnection to set the sub-connection properties.
step.info: The parameter bundle consists of families of parameters. A family is a connected set of parameters, such as QoS. Two families are defined, Quality of Service, KSubConQoSFamily and Authorisation, KSubConAuthorisationFamily.

step.cmd: Group the parameters that apply to an RSubConnection into CSubConParameterFamily families.
step.info: Each parameter family contains parameter sets that are either generic or extension. There is one generic parameter set in a family and zero or more extension parameter sets.

step.cmd: Each family of parameters consists of the values ERequested and the minimum you want to accept EAcceptable.
step.info: If you do not specify the EAcceptable then the ERequested is used as the minimum acceptable.

step.cmd: When the parameters are applied and the subconnection is used then the parameter family is updated with a third set of values that is the EGranted.
step.info: The EGranted is between the EAcceptable and the ERequested.

step.cmd: An event is raised to inform that the parameters are rejected or not granted.
step.info: This occurs after the initial request, asynchronous event notification is used to inform the application what is negotiated. The application must monitor for the granted or rejected event notification.
